intro: Manettia scaberrima, commonly known as the rough manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and rough, hairy leaves. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in ecological and horticultural studies.
